# The `FileOutputBuffer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer">FileOutputBuffer</a> - This interface provides simple way to create an in-memory buffer which will be written to a file. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer">FileOutputBuffer</a> - This interface provides simple way to create an in-memory buffer which will be written to a file.

During the lifetime of these objects, the content or existence of the specified file is undefined. That is, creating an <a href="/docs/api/classes/outputbuffer">OutputBuffer</a> for a file may immediately remove the file. If the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer">FileOutputBuffer</a> is committed, the target file&#39;s content will become the buffer content at the time of the commit. If the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer">FileOutputBuffer</a> is not committed, the file will be deleted in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fileoutputbuffer">FileOutputBuffer</a> destructor.

Definition at line 28 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h">FileOutputBuffer.h</a>.

## Public Destructor

### ~FileOutputBuffer() {#a4f000f4de53568b0618c9271ba71ce01}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual llvm::FileOutputBuffer::~FileOutputBuffer ()"
  labels = {["virtual", "default"]}>
If this object was previously committed, the destructor just deletes this object.

If this object was not committed, the destructor deallocates the buffer and the target file is never written.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h/#l00073">73</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h">FileOutputBuffer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### commit() {#aafb077585b21cdc78ea9bdd1c0624228}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual Error llvm::FileOutputBuffer::commit ()">
Flushes the content of the buffer to its file and deallocates the buffer.

If <a href="#aafb077585b21cdc78ea9bdd1c0624228">commit()</a> is not called before this object&#39;s destructor is called, the file is deleted in the destructor. The optional parameter is used if it turns out you want the file size to be smaller than initially requested.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h/#l00068">68</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h">FileOutputBuffer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::FileOutputBuffer::discard ()"

This removes the temporary file (unless it already was committed) but keeps the memory mapping alive.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Static Functions

### create() {#a3a10ce8cad8fee5d6a4c55270866aa05}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; FileOutputBuffer &gt; &gt; FileOutputBuffer::create (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> FilePath, size&#95;t Size, unsigned Flags=0)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Factory method to create an <a href="/docs/api/classes/outputbuffer">OutputBuffer</a> object which manages a read/write buffer of the specified size.

When committed, the buffer will be written to the file at the specified path.

When F&#95;modify is specified and <code>FilePath</code> refers to an existing on-disk file <code>Size</code> may be set to -1, in which case the entire file is used. Otherwise, the file shrinks or grows as necessary based on the value of <code>Size</code>. It is an error to specify F&#95;modify and Size=-1 if <code>FilePath</code> does not exist.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h/#l00049">49</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileoutputbuffer-h">FileOutputBuffer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/fileoutputbuffer-cpp/#l00159">159</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/fileoutputbuffer-cpp">FileOutputBuffer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
